description: Golden test cases for ethical value detection (IEE Week 2b integration)

metadata.author: TagTeam Core Team
metadata.notes: Tests 50 ethical values across 5 domains - CRITICAL for IEE integration

cases.input: The family must decide whether to continue treatment
cases.notes: Classic end-of-life autonomy vs life tension - from IEE test scenario healthcare-001

cases.input: The doctor must allocate the last ventilator between two critically ill patients
cases.notes: Resource scarcity dilemma - tests 'last' scarcity marker - from IEE healthcare-002

cases.input: The surgeon must decide whether to disclose the error to the patient
cases.notes: Medical error disclosure - truth vs harm - from IEE healthcare-003

cases.input: The parents are demanding an unproven treatment for their dying child
cases.notes: Experimental treatment request - from IEE healthcare-004

cases.input: The psychiatrist must decide whether to commit the patient against their will
cases.notes: Involuntary commitment - classic autonomy vs safety - from IEE healthcare-005

cases.input: The hospital released patient records without consent for research
The surgeon performed an additional procedure without prior consent
The doctor obtained informed consent after explaining all risks and alternatives
cases.notes: Proper informed consent process - positive polarity example

cases.input: The healthcare team treated the homeless patient with the same care as others
cases.notes: Equal treatment regardless of social status

cases.input: The patient chose palliative care to die with dignity at home
The hospital prioritized patients based on medical need, not ability to pay
cases.notes: Just allocation based on need not wealth

cases.input: The community organized to support families affected by the epidemic
The public health mandate required vaccination to protect vulnerable populations
The researcher fabricated data, undermining public trust in science
The organ donor's family received priority access when they later needed a transplant
The committee ensured representation from all affected communities in the decision
The pharmaceutical company refused to lower drug prices for the poor
The program allocated additional resources to underserved communities
The citizens volunteered to help with the disaster relief effort
The hospital accommodated traditional healing practices alongside modern medicine
The hospital invested in renewable energy to reduce environmental impact
The clinic wasted single-use supplies to avoid sterilization costs
cases.notes: Wasteful practices for short-term cost savings

cases.input: The research preserved genetic diversity for future medical breakthroughs
The doctor prescribed antibiotics responsibly to prevent resistance
The healthcare system polluted the river with untreated medical waste
The policy shifted healthcare costs onto future generations through debt
The administrator managed resources prudently to ensure long-term viability
The organization published transparent reports on resource allocation and outcomes
The foundation endowed scholarships for future healthcare workers
The research protocol destroyed unique ecosystems to develop new drugs
The doctor honestly informed the patient about the poor prognosis
The pharmaceutical company concealed adverse trial results from regulators
The laboratory implemented rigorous quality controls to ensure accuracy
The researcher acknowledged limitations and uncertainties in the findings
The witness testified truthfully despite personal consequences
The policy was grounded in empirical evidence and peer-reviewed research
The website spread medical misinformation that endangered public health
The reviewer assessed the research objectively without bias or conflicts
The administrator candidly admitted the mistake and proposed corrections
The patient shared their authentic experience without embellishment
The mentorship program fostered professional development and clinical excellence
The team pioneered innovative surgical techniques that improved outcomes
The student embraced mistakes as opportunities for learning and growth
The therapist helped the patient discover their potential and purpose
The rehabilitation program transformed lives through recovery and renewal
The center pursued excellence through continuous quality improvement
The researcher developed creative solutions to complex medical challenges
The surgeon achieved mastery through decades of dedicated practice
The patient demonstrated remarkable resilience in recovering from trauma
The elder physician shared wisdom gained from years of experience
